thread.title: Sunderland insider confirms top signing is imminent: The club are splashing the cash
thread.title_full: Sunderland insider confirms top signing is imminent: The club are splashing the cash

title: Sunderland insider confirms top signing is imminent: The club are splashing the cash
text:
Sunderland could snap up Andreas Samaris 
The Black Cats bigwig told Portuguese news outlet Noticias Ao Minuto , “the agreement is closed”. 
However, it's suggested the £17m transfer will only be rubber stamped if David Moyes avoids the sack. 
The Scot is feeling the heat and could be packing his bags if his side lose to West Brom today. David Moyes’ former Everton and Manchester United army at Sunderland Friday, 20th January 2017 DAVID MOYES is certainly a big fan of working with players he has previously managed. 1 / 8 Joleon Lescott could be reunited with David Moyes at Sunderland “Sunderland could snap up Andreas Samaris” 
Speaking earlier this week, Moyes claimed he was struggling to sign new players given Sunderland's perilous league position. 
“It’s difficult. I have found that already," he said. 
“I will always tell players how fantastic it is to play at a stadium that gets over 40,000 every week. 
GETTY David Moyes is keen to snap up Andreas Samaris 
"We have fantastic training facilities. You’re coming to work with a manager who wants to build and improve you. 
“But a lot of people will look and say the league position is difficult. 
"And you need a level of finance to go to a certain level of player.” 
GETTY Andreas Samaris is a Greece international 
Signing Samaris would be a real coup for the under-fire boss. 
The 27-year-old Greece international is an experienced campaigner and has racked up 63 appearances for the Portuguese heavyweights. Related articles
